   22: 
   23: -module(ssl_basic_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -behaviour(ct_suite).
   26: 
   27: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   28: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   29: -include_lib("public_key/include/public_key.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_api.hrl").
   31: 
   32: %% Callback functions
   33: -export([all/0,
   34:          groups/0,
   35:          init_per_suite/1,
   36:          end_per_suite/1,
   37:          init_per_testcase/2,
   38:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   39: 
   40: %% Testcases
   41: -export([app/0,
   42:          app/1,
   43:          appup/0,
   44:          appup/1,
   45:          version_option/0,
   46:          version_option/1,
   47:          connect_twice/0,
   48:          connect_twice/1,
   49:          connect_dist/0,
   50:          connect_dist/1,
   51:          defaults/1,
   52:          fallback/0,
   53:          fallback/1,
   54:          cipher_format/0,
   55:          cipher_format/1,
   56:          tls_versions_option/0,
   57:          tls_versions_option/1,
   58:          spawn_opts_option/0,
   59:          spawn_opts_option/1,
   60:          eccs/0,
   61:          eccs/1,
   62:          cipher_suites/0,
   63:          cipher_suites/1,
   64:          cipher_suites_mix/0,
   65:          cipher_suites_mix/1,
   66:          unordered_protocol_versions_server/0,
   67:          unordered_protocol_versions_server/1,
   68:          unordered_protocol_versions_client/0,
   69:          unordered_protocol_versions_client/1,
   70:          fake_root/0,
   71:          fake_root/1,
   72:          fake_root_legacy/0,
   73:          fake_root_legacy/1,
   74:          fake_root_no_intermediate/0,
   75:          fake_root_no_intermediate/1,
   76:          fake_root_no_intermediate_legacy/0,
   77:          fake_root_no_intermediate_legacy/1,
   78:          fake_intermediate_cert/0,
   79:          fake_intermediate_cert/1,
   80:          incomplete_chain_length/0,
   81:          incomplete_chain_length/1,
   82:          user_dies/0,
   83:          user_dies/1
   84:         ]).
   85: 
   86: %% Apply export
   87: -export([tcp_send_recv_result/1,
   88:          result_ok/1,
   89:          protocol_info_result/1,
   90:          version_info_result/1,
   91:          min_heap_size_info/1,
   92:          connect_dist_s/1,
   93:          connect_dist_c/1,
   94:          dummy/1,
   95:          many_client_starter/4
   96:         ]).
   97: 
   98: -define(TIMEOUT, 20000).
   99: -define(EXPIRE, 10).
  100: -define(SLEEP, 500).
  101: -define(RENEGOTIATION_DISABLE_TIME, 12000).
  102: -define(CLEAN_SESSION_DB, 60000).
  103: -define(SEC_RENEGOTIATION_TIMEOUT, 30).
  104: 
  105: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  106: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  107: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  108: all() ->
  109:     [
  110:      {group, basic},
  111:      {group, options}
  112:     ].
  113: 
  114: groups() ->
  115:     [{basic, [], basic_tests()},
  116:      {options, [], options_tests()}
  117:     ].
  118: 
  119: basic_tests() ->
  120:     [app,
  121:      appup,
  122:      version_option,
  123:      connect_twice,
  124:      connect_dist,
  125:      defaults,
  126:      fallback,
  127:      cipher_format,
  128:      tls_versions_option,
  129:      spawn_opts_option,
  130:      eccs,
  131:      cipher_suites,
  132:      cipher_suites_mix,
  133:      fake_root,
  134:      fake_root_no_intermediate,
  135:      fake_root_legacy,
  136:      fake_root_no_intermediate_legacy,
  137:      fake_intermediate_cert,
  138:      incomplete_chain_length,
  139:      user_dies
  140:     ].
  141: 
  142: options_tests() ->
  143:     [
  144:      unordered_protocol_versions_server,
  145:      unordered_protocol_versions_client].
  146: 
  147: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  148:     catch crypto:stop(),
  149:     try crypto:start() of
  150: 	ok ->
  151: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  152:             ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert(Config0)
  153:     catch _:_ ->
  154: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  155:     end.
  156: 
  157: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  158:     ssl:stop(),
  159:     application:stop(crypto).
  160: 
  161: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  162: init_per_testcase(eccs, Config) ->
  163:     case ssl:eccs() of
  164:         [] ->
  165:             {skip, "named curves not supported"};
  166:         [_|_] ->
  167:             ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  168:             ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
  169:             Config
  170:     end;
  171: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  172:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  173:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 5}),
  174:     Config.
  175: 
  176: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  177:     Config.
  178: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  179: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  180: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  181: app() ->
  182:     [{doc, "Test that the ssl app file is ok"}].
  183: app(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  184:     ok = test_server:app_test(ssl).
  185: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  186: appup() ->
  187:     [{doc, "Test that the ssl appup file is ok"}].
  188: appup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  189:     ok = test_server:appup_test(ssl).
  190: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  191: version_option() ->
  192:     [{doc, "Use version option and do no specify ciphers list. Bug specified incorrect ciphers"}].
  193: version_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  194:     Versions = proplists:get_value(supported, ssl:versions()),
  195:     [version_option_test(Config, Version) || Version <- Versions].
  196: 
  197: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  198: connect_twice() ->
  199:     [{doc,""}].
  200: connect_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  201:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  202:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  203: 
  204:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  205: 
  206:     Server =
  207: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  208: 				   {from, self()},
  209: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
  210: 				   {options,  [{keepalive, true},{active, false}
  211: 					       | ServerOpts]}]),
  212:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  213:     Client =
  214: 	ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  215: 				   {host, Hostname},
  216: 				   {from, self()},
  217: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
  218: 				   {options, [{keepalive, true},{active, false}
  219: 					      | ClientOpts]}]),
  220:     Server ! listen,
  221: 
  222:     {Client1, #sslsocket{}} =
  223: 	ssl_test_lib:start_client([return_socket,
  224: 				   {node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  225: 				   {host, Hostname},
  226: 				   {from, self()},
  227: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
  228: 				   {options, [{keepalive, true},{active, false}
  229: 					      | ClientOpts]}]),
  230: 
  231:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  232: 
  233:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  234:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client1, ok),
  235: 
  236:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  237:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client),
  238:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client1).
  239: defaults(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  240:     Versions = ssl:versions(),
  241:     false = lists:member(sslv3, proplists:get_value(available, Versions)),
  242:     false = lists:member(sslv3,  proplists:get_value(supported, Versions)),
  243:     true = lists:member('tlsv1', proplists:get_value(available, Versions)),
  244:     false = lists:member('tlsv1',  proplists:get_value(supported, Versions)),
  245:     true = lists:member('tlsv1.1', proplists:get_value(available, Versions)),
  246:     false = lists:member('tlsv1.1',  proplists:get_value(supported, Versions)),
  247:     true = lists:member('tlsv1.2', proplists:get_value(available, Versions)),
  248:     true = lists:member('tlsv1.2',  proplists:get_value(supported, Versions)),
  249:     true = lists:member('dtlsv1.2', proplists:get_value(available_dtls, Versions)),
  250:     true = lists:member('dtlsv1', proplists:get_value(available_dtls, Versions)),
  251:     true = lists:member('dtlsv1.2', proplists:get_value(supported_dtls, Versions)),
  252:     false = lists:member('dtlsv1', proplists:get_value(supported_dtls, Versions)).
  253: 
  254: 
  255: fallback() ->
  256:     [{doc, "Test TLS_FALLBACK_SCSV downgrade prevention"}].
  257: 
  258: fallback(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  260:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  261:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  262: 
  263:     Server =
  264: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server_error([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  265: 					 {from, self()},
  266: 					 {options, ServerOpts}]),
  267: 
  268:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  269: 
  270:     Client =
  271:         ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode},
  272:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  273:                                          {from, self()},  {options,
  274:                                                            [{fallback, true},
  275:                                                             {versions, ['tlsv1']}
  276:                                                             | ClientOpts]}]),
  277:     ssl_test_lib:check_server_alert(Server, Client, inappropriate_fallback).
  278: 
  279: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  280: cipher_format() ->
  281:     [{doc, "Test that cipher conversion from maps | tuples | strings to binarys works"}].
  282: cipher_format(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  283:     {ok, Socket0} = ssl:listen(0, [{ciphers, ssl:cipher_suites(default, 'tlsv1.2')}]),
  284:     ssl:close(Socket0).
  285: 
  286: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  287: 
  288: cipher_suites() ->
  289:     [{doc,"Test API function cipher_suites/2, filter_cipher_suites/2"
  290:       " and prepend|append_cipher_suites/2"}].
  291: 
  292: cipher_suites(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.3'),
  294:     chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.2'),
  295:     chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.1'),
  296:     chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1'),
  297:     chipher_suite_checks('dtlsv1.2'),
  298:     chipher_suite_checks('dtlsv1'),
  299:     anon_chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.3'),
  300:     anon_chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.2'),
  301:     anon_chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.1'),
  302:     anon_chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1'),
  303:     anon_chipher_suite_checks('dtlsv1.2'),
  304:     anon_chipher_suite_checks('dtlsv1').
  305: 
  306: 
  307: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  308: cipher_suites_mix() ->
  309:     [{doc,"Test to have old and new cipher suites at the same time"}].
  310: 
  311: cipher_suites_mix(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  312:     CipherSuites = [{dhe_rsa,aes_128_cbc,sha256,sha256}, {dhe_rsa,aes_128_cbc,sha}],
  313:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  314:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  315: 
  316:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  317: 
  318:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  319: 					{from, self()},
  320: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  321: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
  322:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  323:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  324: 					{host, Hostname},
  325: 					{from, self()},
  326: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  327: 					{options, [{versions, ['tlsv1.2']},{ciphers, CipherSuites} | ClientOpts]}]),
  328: 
  329:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  330:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  331:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  332: unordered_protocol_versions_server() ->
  333:     [{doc,"Test that the highest protocol is selected even"
  334:       " when it is not first in the versions list."}].
  335: 
  336: unordered_protocol_versions_server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  338:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  339: 
  340:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  341:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  342: 					{from, self()},
  343: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, protocol_info_result, []}},
  344: 					{options, [{versions, ['tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2']} | ServerOpts]}]),
  345:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  346: 
  347:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  348: 					{host, Hostname},
  349: 					{from, self()},
  350: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, protocol_info_result, []}},
  351: 					{options, ClientOpts}]),
  352: 
  353:     ServerMsg = ClientMsg = {ok,'tlsv1.2'},
  354:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg).
  355: 
  356: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  357: unordered_protocol_versions_client() ->
  358:     [{doc,"Test that the highest protocol is selected even"
  359:       " when it is not first in the versions list."}].
  360: 
  361: unordered_protocol_versions_client(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  362:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  363:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  364: 
  365:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  366:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  367: 					{from, self()},
  368: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, protocol_info_result, []}},
  369: 					{options, ServerOpts }]),
  370:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  371: 
  372:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  373: 					{host, Hostname},
  374: 					{from, self()},
  375: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, protocol_info_result, []}},
  376: 					{options,  [{versions, ['tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2']} | ClientOpts]}]),
  377: 
  378:     ServerMsg = ClientMsg = {ok, 'tlsv1.2'},
  379:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ServerMsg, Client, ClientMsg).
  380: 
  381: connect_dist() ->
  382:     [{doc,"Test a simple connect as is used by distribution"}].
  383: 
  384: connect_dist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  385:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  386:     ClientOpts = [{active, false}, {packet,4}|ClientOpts0],
  387:     ServerOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  388:     ServerOpts = [{active, false}, {packet,4}|ServerOpts0],
  389: 
  390:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  391: 
  392:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  393: 					{from, self()},
  394: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, connect_dist_s, []}},
  395: 					{options, ServerOpts}]),
  396:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  397:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  398: 					{host, Hostname},
  399: 					{from, self()},
  400: 					{mfa, {?MODULE, connect_dist_c, []}},
  401: 					{options, ClientOpts}]),
  402: 
  403:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  404: 
  405:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  406:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  407: eccs() ->
  408:     [{doc, "Test API functions eccs/0 and eccs/1"}].
  409: 
  410: eccs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  411:     [_|_] = All = ssl:eccs(),
  412:     [_|_] = Tls = ssl:eccs(tlsv1),
  413:     [_|_] = Tls1 = ssl:eccs('tlsv1.1'),
  414:     [_|_] = Tls2 = ssl:eccs('tlsv1.2'),
  415:     [_|_] = Tls1 = ssl:eccs('dtlsv1'),
  416:     [_|_] = Tls2 = ssl:eccs('dtlsv1.2'),
  417:     ok.
  418: 
  419: tls_versions_option() ->
  420:     [{doc,"Test API versions option to connect/listen."}].
  421: tls_versions_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  422:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  423:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  424: 
  425:     Supported = proplists:get_value(supported, ssl:versions()),
  426:     Available = proplists:get_value(available, ssl:versions()),
  427:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  428:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  429: 					{from, self()},
  430: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  431: 					{options, [{versions, Supported} | ServerOpts]}]),
  432:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  433: 
  434:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  435: 					{host, Hostname},
  436: 					{from, self()},
  437: 					{mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  438: 					{options, ClientOpts}]),
  439: 
  440:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  441:     Server ! listen,
  442:     Versions = remove_supported_versions(Available, Supported),
  443:     ErrClient = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  444: 						 {host, Hostname},
  445: 						 {from, self()},
  446: 						 {options, [{versions , Versions} | ClientOpts]}]),
  447:     receive
  448: 	{Server, _} ->
  449: 	    ok
  450:     end,
  451:     ssl_test_lib:check_client_alert(ErrClient, protocol_version).
  452: 
  453: spawn_opts_option() ->
  454:     [{doc,"Test API spawn_opts option to sender/receiver."}].
  455: spawn_opts_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  456:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  457:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  458: 
  459:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  460:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  461:                     {from, self()},
  462:                     {mfa, {?MODULE, min_heap_size_info, []}},
  463:                     {options, [{sender_spawn_opts, [{min_heap_size, 1598}]},
  464:                                {receiver_spawn_opts, [{min_heap_size, 2586}]} | ServerOpts]}]),
  465:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  466: 
  467:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  468:                     {host, Hostname},
  469:                     {from, self()},
  470:                     {mfa, {?MODULE, min_heap_size_info, []}},
  471:                     {options, [{sender_spawn_opts, [{min_heap_size, 1598}]},
  472:                                {receiver_spawn_opts, [{min_heap_size, 2586}]} | ClientOpts]}]),
  473: 
  474:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, {ok, 2586, 1598}, Client, {ok, 2586, 1598}).
  475: 
  476: fake_root() ->
  477:     [{doc,"Test that we can not use a fake root signed by other key but with correct name and serial number."}].
  478: fake_root(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  479:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  480: 
  481:     Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [keyCertSign, cRLSign, digitalSignature, keyAgreement]}]),
  482:     ROOT = #{cert := Cert,
  483:              key := _Key} = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},
  484:                                                                               {digest, sha256},
  485:                                                                               {extensions, Ext}]),
  486:     FakeKey = ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1),
  487:     OTPCert = public_key:pkix_decode_cert(Cert, otp),
  488:     TBS = OTPCert#'OTPCertificate'.tbsCertificate,
  489:     FakeCert = public_key:pkix_sign(TBS, FakeKey),
  490: 
  491:     AuthExt = #'AuthorityKeyIdentifier'{authorityCertIssuer = [{directoryName, TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.issuer}],
  492:                                         authorityCertSerialNumber = TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.serialNumber},
  493:     [AuthKeyExt] = x509_test:extensions([{?'id-ce-authorityKeyIdentifier',
  494:                                           AuthExt,
  495:                                           false}]),
  496:     #{server_config := ServerConf,
  497:       client_config := ClientConf} =
  498:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  499:                                         #{root => ROOT,
  500:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)},
  501:                                                              {digest, sha256},
  502:                                                              {extensions, [AuthKeyExt]}]],
  503:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)},
  504:                                                     {digest, sha256}]},
  505:                                     client_chain =>
  506:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  507:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  508:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  509:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  510:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  511:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  512:                                  ),
  513: 
  514:     #{server_config := FakeServerConf} =
  515:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  516:                                         #{root =>  #{cert => FakeCert, key => FakeKey},
  517:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  518:                                                              {digest, sha256},
  519:                                                              {extensions, [AuthKeyExt]}]],
  520:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  521:                                                    {digest, sha256}]},
  522:                                     client_chain =>
  523:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  524:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  525:                                           intermediates =>  [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  526:                                                               {digest, sha256}]],
  527:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  528:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  529:                                  ),
  530: 
  531:     test_fake_root(Hostname, ServerNode, ClientNode, ServerConf,
  532:                    ClientConf, FakeCert, FakeServerConf, bad_certificate, bad_certificate).
  533: 
  534: fake_root_no_intermediate() ->
  535:     [{doc,"Test that we can not use a fake root signed by other key but with correct name and serial number."}].
  536: 
  537: fake_root_no_intermediate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  539: 
  540:     Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [keyCertSign, cRLSign, digitalSignature, keyAgreement]}]),
  541:     ROOT = #{cert := Cert,
  542:              key := _Key} = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},
  543:                                                                               {digest, sha256},
  544:                                                                               {extensions, Ext}]),
  545: 
  546:     FakeKey = ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1),
  547:     OTPCert = public_key:pkix_decode_cert(Cert, otp),
  548:     TBS = OTPCert#'OTPCertificate'.tbsCertificate,
  549:     FakeCert = public_key:pkix_sign(TBS, FakeKey),
  550: 
  551:     AuthExt = #'AuthorityKeyIdentifier'{authorityCertIssuer = [{directoryName, TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.issuer}],
  552:                                         authorityCertSerialNumber = TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.serialNumber},
  553:     [AuthKeyExt] = x509_test:extensions([{?'id-ce-authorityKeyIdentifier',
  554:                                           AuthExt,
  555:                                           false}]),
  556:     #{server_config := ServerConf,
  557:       client_config := ClientConf} =
  558:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  559:                                         #{root => ROOT,
  560:                                           intermediates => [],
  561:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)},
  562:                                                     {digest, sha256},
  563:                                                     {extensions, [AuthKeyExt]}]},
  564:                                     client_chain =>
  565:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  566:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  567:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  568:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  569:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  570:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}),
  571: 
  572:     #{server_config := FakeServerConf} =
  573:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  574:                                         #{root =>  #{cert => FakeCert, key => FakeKey},
  575:                                           intermediates => [],
  576:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  577:                                                    {digest, sha256},
  578:                                                    {extensions, [AuthKeyExt]}]},
  579:                                     client_chain =>
  580:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  581:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  582:                                           intermediates =>  [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  583:                                                               {digest, sha256}]],
  584:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  585:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}),
  586: 
  587:     test_fake_root(Hostname, ServerNode, ClientNode, ServerConf,
  588:                    ClientConf, FakeCert, FakeServerConf, bad_certificate, bad_certificate).
  589: 
  590: fake_root_legacy() ->
  591:     [{doc,"Test that we can not use a fake root signed by other key but with correct name and serial number."}].
  592: fake_root_legacy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  593:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  594: 
  595:     Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [keyCertSign, cRLSign, digitalSignature, keyAgreement]}]),
  596:     ROOT = #{cert := Cert,
  597:              key := _Key} = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},
  598:                                                                               {digest, sha256},
  599:                                                                               {extensions, Ext}]),
  600:     FakeKey = ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1),
  601:     OTPCert = public_key:pkix_decode_cert(Cert, otp),
  602:     TBS = OTPCert#'OTPCertificate'.tbsCertificate,
  603:     FakeCert = public_key:pkix_sign(TBS, FakeKey),
  604:     #{server_config := ServerConf,
  605:       client_config := ClientConf} =
  606:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  607:                                         #{root => ROOT,
  608:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)},
  609:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  610:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)},
  611:                                                     {digest, sha256}]},
  612:                                     client_chain =>
  613:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  614:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  615:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  616:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  617:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  618:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}),
  619:     #{server_config := FakeServerConf} =
  620:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  621:                                         #{root =>  #{cert => FakeCert, key => FakeKey},
  622:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  623:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  624:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  625:                                                    {digest, sha256}]},
  626:                                     client_chain =>
  627:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  628:                                                    {digest, sha256} ],
  629:                                           intermediates =>  [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  630:                                                               {digest, sha256}]],
  631:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  632:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  633:                                  ),
  634:     test_fake_root(Hostname, ServerNode, ClientNode, ServerConf,
  635:                    ClientConf, FakeCert, FakeServerConf, unknown_ca, unknown_ca).
  636: 
  637: fake_root_no_intermediate_legacy() ->
  638:     [{doc,"Test that we can not use a fake root signed by other key but with correct name and serial number."}].
  639: fake_root_no_intermediate_legacy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  640:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  641: 
  642:     Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [keyCertSign, cRLSign, digitalSignature, keyAgreement]}]),
  643:     ROOT = #{cert := Cert,
  644:              key := _Key} = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},
  645:                                                                               {digest, sha256},
  646:                                                                               {extensions, Ext}]),
  647: 
  648:     FakeKey = ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1),
  649:     OTPCert = public_key:pkix_decode_cert(Cert, otp),
  650:     TBS = OTPCert#'OTPCertificate'.tbsCertificate,
  651:     FakeCert = public_key:pkix_sign(TBS, FakeKey),
  652: 
  653:     #{server_config := ServerConf,
  654:       client_config := ClientConf} =
  655:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  656:                                         #{root => ROOT,
  657:                                           intermediates => [],
  658:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)},
  659:                                                     {digest, sha256}]},
  660:                                     client_chain =>
  661:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  662:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  663:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  664:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  665:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)}]}}
  666:                                  ),
  667:     #{server_config := FakeServerConf} =
  668:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  669:                                         #{root =>  #{cert => FakeCert, key => FakeKey},
  670:                                           intermediates => [],
  671:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  672:                                                    {digest, sha256}]},
  673:                                     client_chain =>
  674:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  675:                                                    {digest, sha256}
  676:                                                   ],
  677:                                           intermediates =>  [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  678:                                                               {digest, sha256}]],
  679:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  680:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}),
  681:     test_fake_root(Hostname, ServerNode, ClientNode, ServerConf,
  682:                    ClientConf, FakeCert, FakeServerConf, unknown_ca, unknown_ca).
  683: 
  684: fake_intermediate_cert() ->
  685:     [{doc,"Test that we can not use a fake intermediat cert claiming to be signed by a trusted ROOT but is not."}].
  686: 
  687: fake_intermediate_cert(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  688:      {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  689:      Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [keyCertSign, cRLSign, digitalSignature, keyAgreement]}]),
  690:      ROOT = #{cert := Cert,
  691:               key := _Key} = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},
  692:                                                                                {digest, sha256},
  693:                                                                                {extensions, Ext}]),
  694:     OtherSROOT = #{cert := OtherSCert,
  695:                    key := OtherSKey} =
  696:         public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("OTHER SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  697:                                                                 {digest, sha256},
  698:                                                                 {extensions, Ext}]),
  699:     OtherCROOT = #{cert := OtherCCert,
  700:                    key := _OtherCKey} =
  701:         public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("OTHER Client ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  702:                                                                 {digest, sha256},
  703:                                                                 {extensions, Ext}]),
  704:     #{client_config := ClientConf} =
  705:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  706:                                         #{root => ROOT,
  707:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)},
  708:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  709:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)},
  710:                                                     {digest, sha256}]},
  711:                                     client_chain =>
  712:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  713:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  714:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  715:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  716:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  717:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  718:                                  ),
  719: 
  720:     #{server_config := OtherServerConf} =
  721:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  722:                                         #{root => OtherSROOT,
  723:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  724:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  725:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  726:                                                     {digest, sha256}]},
  727:                                     client_chain =>
  728:                                         #{root => OtherCROOT,
  729:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  730:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  731:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  732:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  733:                                  ),
  734:     OTPCert = public_key:pkix_decode_cert(Cert, otp),
  735:     TBS = OTPCert#'OTPCertificate'.tbsCertificate,
  736:     TBSExt = TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.extensions,
  737:     AuthExt = #'AuthorityKeyIdentifier'{authorityCertIssuer = [{directoryName, TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.issuer}],
  738:                                         authorityCertSerialNumber = TBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'.serialNumber},
  739:     [AuthKeyExt] = x509_test:extensions([{?'id-ce-authorityKeyIdentifier',
  740:                                           AuthExt,
  741:                                           false}]),
  742: 
  743:     CAs = proplists:get_value(cacerts, OtherServerConf),
  744: 
  745:     [ICA] = CAs -- [OtherSCert, OtherCCert],
  746: 
  747:     OTPICACert = public_key:pkix_decode_cert(ICA, otp),
  748:     ICATBS = OTPICACert#'OTPCertificate'.tbsCertificate,
  749: 
  750:     FakeICA = public_key:pkix_sign(ICATBS#'OTPTBSCertificate'{extensions = [AuthKeyExt | TBSExt]}, OtherSKey),
  751: 
  752:     ServerCert = proplists:get_value(cert, OtherServerConf),
  753:     FakeServer = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  754:                                             {from, self()},
  755:                                             {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  756:                                             {options, [{cert, [ServerCert, FakeICA]} |
  757:                                                        proplists:delete(cert, OtherServerConf)]
  758:                                             }]),
  759:     Port1 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(FakeServer),
  760:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port1},
  761:                                                {host, Hostname},
  762:                                                {from, self()},
  763:                                                {options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientConf]}]),
  764: 
  765:     ssl_test_lib:check_client_alert(Client1, bad_certificate).
  766: 
  767: incomplete_chain_length() ->
  768:     [{doc,"Test that attempts to reconstruct incomplete chains does not make shorter incomplete chains"}].
  769: incomplete_chain_length(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  770:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  771:     Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [keyCertSign, cRLSign, digitalSignature, keyAgreement]}]),
  772:     ROOT = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},
  773:                                                              {digest, sha256},
  774:                                                              {extensions, Ext}]),
  775: 
  776:     OtherROOT = public_key:pkix_test_root_cert("OTHER SERVER ROOT CA", [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  777:                                                                                               {extensions, Ext}]),
  778:     #{client_config := ClientConf} =
  779:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  780:                                         #{root => ROOT,
  781:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)},
  782:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  783:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)}, {digest, sha256}]},
  784:                                     client_chain =>
  785:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  786:                                                    {digest, sha256} ],
  787:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  788:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  789:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  790:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  791:                                  ),
  792: 
  793:     #{server_config := ServerConf} =
  794:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  795:                                         #{root => OtherROOT,
  796:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  797:                                                              {digest, sha256} ],
  798:                                                             [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  799:                                                              {digest, sha256} ]
  800:                                                            ],
  801:                                           peer =>  [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  802:                                                     {digest, sha256}]},
  803:                                                                  client_chain =>
  804:                                         #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  805:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  806:                                           intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  807:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  808:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  809:                                                    {digest, sha256}]}}
  810:                                  ),
  811: 
  812:     VerifyFun = {fun(_,{bad_cert, unknown_ca}, UserState) ->
  813:                          %% accept this error to provoke the
  814:                          %% building of an shorter incomplete chain
  815:                          %% than the one received
  816:                          {valid, UserState};
  817:                     (_,{extension, _} = Extension, #{ext := N} = UserState) ->
  818:                          ?CT_LOG("~p", [Extension]),
  819:                          {unknown,  UserState#{ext => N +1}};
  820:                     (_, valid, #{intermediates := N} = UserState) ->
  821:                          {valid, UserState#{intermediates => N +1}};
  822:                     (_, valid_peer, #{intermediates := 2,
  823:                                       ext := 1} = UserState) ->
  824:                          {valid, UserState};
  825:                     (_, valid_peer, UserState) ->
  826:                          ?CT_LOG("~p", [UserState]),
  827:                          {error, {bad_cert, too_short_path}}
  828:                  end, #{intermediates => 0,
  829:                         ext => 0}},
  830: 
  831:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  832:                                         {from, self()},
  833:                                         {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  834:                                         {options, ServerConf}
  835:                                         ]),
  836:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  837: 
  838:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  839:                                         {host, Hostname},
  840:                                         {from, self()},
  841:                                         {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  842:                                         {options, [{verify, verify_peer}, {verify_fun, VerifyFun} | ClientConf]}]),
  843:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Client, ok, Server, ok).
  844: 
  845: 
  846: user_dies() ->
  847:     [{doc, "Test that we do not leak processess when user dies during startup of connection"}].
  848: user_dies(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  849:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  850:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  851:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  852:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  853: 
  854:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  855:     Server = spawn_link(fun() ->
  856:                                 {ok, L} = ssl:listen(Port, ServerOpts),
  857:                                 loop(L)
  858:                         end),
  859:     do_wait_tls_server(Hostname, Port),
  860:     {ok,_}  = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  861:     check_process_count(2),
  862:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> many_client_starter(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts, Server) end),
  863:     receive
  864:         {'EXIT', Pid, _} ->
  865:             check_process_count(2)
  866:     end.
  867: 
  868: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  869: %% callback functions ------------------------------------------------
  870: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  871: tcp_send_recv_result(Socket) ->
  872:     gen_tcp:send(Socket, "Hello world"),
  873:     {ok,"Hello world"} = gen_tcp:recv(Socket, 11),
  874:     ok.
  875: 
  876: result_ok(_Socket) ->
  877:     ok.
  878: 
  879: 
  880: protocol_info_result(Socket) ->
  881:     {ok, [{protocol, PVersion}]} = ssl:connection_information(Socket, [protocol]),
  882:     {ok, PVersion}.
  883: 
  884: version_info_result(Socket) ->
  885:     {ok, [{version, Version}]} = ssl:connection_information(Socket, [version]),
  886:     {ok, Version}.
  887: 
  888: min_heap_size_info(#sslsocket{pid = [Receiver, Sender]}) ->
  889:     {garbage_collection, ReceiverGc} = process_info(Receiver, garbage_collection),
  890:     {garbage_collection, SenderGc} = process_info(Sender, garbage_collection),
  891:     {ok, proplists:get_value(min_heap_size, ReceiverGc), proplists:get_value(min_heap_size, SenderGc)}.
  892: 
  893: connect_dist_s(S) ->
  894:     Msg = term_to_binary({erlang,term}),
  895:     ok = ssl:send(S, Msg).
  896: 
  897: connect_dist_c(S) ->
  898:     Test = binary_to_list(term_to_binary({erlang,term})),
  899:     {ok, Test} = ssl:recv(S, 0, 10000),
  900:     ok.
  901: 
  902: dummy(_Socket) ->
  903:     %% Should not happen as the ssl connection will not be established
  904:     %% due to fatal handshake failure
  905:     exit(kill).
  906: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  907: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
  908: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  909: version_option_test(Config, Version) ->
  910:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  911:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  912:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  913:     Server =
  914: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  915: 				   {from, self()},
  916: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
  917: 				   {options,  [{active, false}, {versions, [Version]}| ServerOpts]}]),
  918:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  919:     Client =
  920: 	ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  921: 				   {host, Hostname},
  922: 				   {from, self()},
  923: 				   {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result, []}},
  924: 				   {options, [{active, false}, {versions, [Version]}| ClientOpts]}]),
  925: 
  926:     ?CT_LOG("Client ~p  Server ~p ~n", [Client, Server]),
  927:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  928:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  929:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  930: 
  931: remove_supported_versions(Available, Supported) ->
  932:     Versions0 = Available -- Supported,
  933:     case lists:member('tlsv1.3', Versions0) andalso
  934:         not lists:member('tlsv1.2', Versions0) of
  935:         true ->
  936:             %% If 'tlsv1.2' is removed, remove also 'tlsv1.3'
  937:             Versions0 -- ['tlsv1.3'];
  938:         _ ->
  939:             Versions0
  940:     end.
  941: 
  942: 
  943: test_fake_root(Hostname, ServerNode, ClientNode, ServerConf, ClientConf, FakeCert, FakeServerConf,
  944:                ResultRootIncluded, ResultRootExcluded) ->
  945:     RealServer = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  946:                                             {from, self()},
  947:                                             {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  948:                                              {options, ServerConf}]),
  949:     Port0 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(RealServer),
  950:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port0},
  951:                                          {host, Hostname},
  952:                                           {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  953:                                          {from, self()},
  954:                                          {options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientConf]}]),
  955: 
  956:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(RealServer, ok, Client0, ok),
  957: 
  958:     ssl_test_lib:close(RealServer),
  959:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  960: 
  961:     %% Fake server sends ROOT cert
  962:     FakeServer = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  963:                                             {from, self()},
  964:                                             {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  965:                                             {options, FakeServerConf}]),
  966:     Port1 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(FakeServer),
  967: 
  968:     Client1 = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port1},
  969:                                                {host, Hostname},
  970:                                                {from, self()},
  971:                                                {options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientConf]}]),
  972: 
  973:     ssl_test_lib:check_client_alert(Client1, ResultRootIncluded),
  974: 
  975:     %%Fake server does not send ROOT cert
  976:     CAS0 = proplists:get_value(cacerts, FakeServerConf),
  977:     CAS1 = CAS0 -- [FakeCert],
  978: 
  979:     FakeServer1 = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  980:                                              {from, self()},
  981:                                              {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  982:                                              {options, [{cacerts, CAS1} | proplists:delete(cacerts, FakeServerConf)]}]),
  983: 
  984:     Port2 = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(FakeServer1),
  985:     Client2 = ssl_test_lib:start_client_error([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port2},
  986:                                                {host, Hostname},
  987:                                               {from, self()},
  988:                                                {options, [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientConf]}]),
  989:     ssl_test_lib:check_client_alert(Client2, ResultRootExcluded),
  990:     ssl_test_lib:close(FakeServer1).
  991: 
  992: anon_chipher_suite_checks('tlsv1.3' = Version) ->
  993:     [] = ssl:cipher_suites(anonymous, Version),
  994:     [] = ssl:cipher_suites(exclusive_anonymous, Version);
  995: anon_chipher_suite_checks(Version) ->
  996:     [_|_] = ssl:cipher_suites(anonymous, Version),
  997:     [_|_] = ssl:cipher_suites(exclusive_anonymous, Version).
  998: 
  999: chipher_suite_checks(Version) ->
 1000:     MandatoryCipherSuiteTLS1_0TLS1_1 = #{key_exchange => rsa,
 1001:                                          cipher => '3des_ede_cbc',
 1002:                                          mac => sha,
 1003:                                          prf => default_prf},
 1004:     MandatoryCipherSuiteTLS1_0TLS1_2 = #{key_exchange =>rsa,
 1005:                                          cipher => 'aes_128_cbc',
 1006:                                          mac => sha,
 1007:                                          prf => default_prf},
 1008:     All = [_|_] = ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version),
 1009:     Default = [_|_] = ssl:cipher_suites(default, Version),
 1010:     Anonymous = ssl:cipher_suites(anonymous, Version),
 1011:     true = length(Default) < length(All),
 1012:     Filters = [{key_exchange,
 1013:                 fun(dhe_rsa) ->
 1014:                         true;
 1015:                    (_) ->
 1016:                         false
 1017:                 end
 1018:                },
 1019:                {cipher,
 1020:                 fun(aes_256_cbc) ->
 1021:                         true;
 1022:                    (_) ->
 1023:                         false
 1024:                 end
 1025:                },
 1026:                {mac,
 1027:                 fun(sha) ->
 1028:                         true;
 1029:                    (_) ->
 1030:                         false
 1031:                 end
 1032:                }
 1033:               ],
 1034:     Cipher = #{cipher => aes_256_cbc,
 1035:                key_exchange => dhe_rsa,
 1036:                mac => sha,
 1037:                prf => default_prf},
 1038:     [Cipher] = ssl:filter_cipher_suites(All, Filters),
 1039:     [Cipher | Rest0] = ssl:prepend_cipher_suites([Cipher], Default),
 1040:     [Cipher | Rest0] = ssl:prepend_cipher_suites(Filters, Default),
 1041:     true = lists:member(Cipher, Default),
 1042:     false = lists:member(Cipher, Rest0),
 1043:     [Cipher | Rest1] = lists:reverse(ssl:append_cipher_suites([Cipher], Default)),
 1044:     [Cipher | Rest1] = lists:reverse(ssl:append_cipher_suites(Filters, Default)),
 1045:     true = lists:member(Cipher, Default),
 1046:     false = lists:member(Cipher, Rest1),
 1047:     [] = lists:dropwhile(fun(X) -> not lists:member(X, Default) end, Anonymous),
 1048:     [] = lists:dropwhile(fun(X) -> not lists:member(X, All) end, Anonymous),
 1049:     case Version of
 1050:         tlsv1 ->
 1051:             true = lists:member(MandatoryCipherSuiteTLS1_0TLS1_1, All);
 1052:         'tlsv1.1' ->
 1053:             true = lists:member(MandatoryCipherSuiteTLS1_0TLS1_1, All),
 1054:             true = lists:member(MandatoryCipherSuiteTLS1_0TLS1_2, All);
 1055:         'tlsv1.2' ->
 1056:             ok;
 1057:         'tlsv1.3' ->
 1058:             ok;
 1059:         'dtlsv1' ->
 1060:             true = lists:member(MandatoryCipherSuiteTLS1_0TLS1_2, All);
 1061:         'dtlsv1.2' ->
 1062:             ok
 1063:     end.
 1064: 
 1065: many_client_starter(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts, Server) ->
 1066:     spawn_clients(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts, 50),
 1067:     ct:sleep(100),
 1068:     many_client_starter(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts, Server).
 1069: 
 1070: spawn_clients(_, _, _, 0) ->
 1071:     ok;
 1072: spawn_clients(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts, N) ->
 1073:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1074:                      case N of
 1075:                          20 ->
 1076:                              exit(self(), kill);
 1077:                          _ ->
 1078:                              {ok, _} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts)
 1079:                      end
 1080:                end),
 1081:     spawn_clients(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts, N-1).
 1082: 
 1083: loop(L) ->
 1084:     {ok, A} = ssl:transport_accept(L),
 1085:     spawn(fun() ->
 1086:                   ssl:handshake(A)
 1087:           end),
 1088:     loop(L).
 1089: 
 1090: check_process_count(Count) ->
 1091:     check_process_count(Count, 5).
 1092: 
 1093: check_process_count(Count, 0) ->
 1094:     Count = proplists:get_value(supervisors, supervisor:count_children(tls_connection_sup));
 1095: check_process_count(Count, Try) ->
 1096:     case proplists:get_value(supervisors, supervisor:count_children(tls_connection_sup)) of
 1097:         Count ->
 1098:             ok;
 1099:         Other ->
 1100:             ?CT_PAL("Not expected number of cildren ~p on try ~p",
 1101:                     [Other, Try]),
 1102:             ct:sleep(500), %% Wait long enough
 1103:             check_process_count(Count, Try - 1)
 1104:     end.
 1105: 
 1106: do_wait_tls_server(Hostname, Port) ->
 1107:     do_wait_tls_server(Hostname, Port, 5).
 1108: 
 1109: do_wait_tls_server(_,_, 0)->
 1110:     ct:fail(to_connect_to_server);
 1111: do_wait_tls_server(Hostname, Port, Try) ->
 1112:     case gen_tcp:connect(Hostname, Port, []) of
 1113: 	{ok, S} ->
 1114: 	    gen_tcp:close(S),
 1115:             ok;
 1116: 	_  ->
 1117: 	    ct:sleep(?SLEEP),
 1118: 	    do_wait_tls_server(Hostname, Port, Try-1)
 1119:     end.
